diseaseDescription: A common fungal disease affecting orchids, causing leaf spots and necrosis.

culturalCare.title: Control Humidity
steps: Keep relative humidity below 60–70%
Use air conditioning indoors if needed
Avoid overcrowding plants

culturalCare.title: Air Circulation
steps: Place orchids with some space between them
Use a small fan to circulate air gently

culturalCare.title: Watering
steps: Water early in the morning at the base or root zone
Ensure potting mix drains well; avoid standing water

culturalCare.title: Remove Diseased Leaves
steps: Trim infected leaves with black patches
Burn or seal leaves in a bag immediately

culturalCare.title: Tool Hygiene
steps: Clean scissors or shears after each cut
Use 70% alcohol or 10% bleach solution, then rinse

chemicalControl.title: Copper-based Fungicides
steps: Use copper hydroxide or copper oxychloride at 2–3 g/L
Spray all leaves including undersides
Repeat every 7–10 days; avoid overuse

chemicalControl.title: Mancozeb
steps: Use 2 g/L solution
Cover all foliage evenly
Apply every 10–14 days

chemicalControl.title: Systemic Fungicides
steps: Use azoxystrobin or thiophanate-methyl
Follow label instructions carefully
Apply every 14–21 days to protect new growth

chemicalControl.title: Rotation
steps: Alternate copper, mancozeb, and systemic fungicides to prevent resistance

ecoFriendly.title: Neem Oil
steps: Use 2–3 ml/L
Spray all plant surfaces weekly

ecoFriendly.title: Baking Soda Mix
steps: Mix 1 tsp baking soda + few drops mild soap per liter of water
Spray leaves weekly to prevent fungus

ecoFriendly.title: Cinnamon Powder
steps: Dust on minor leaf lesions after trimming
Acts as a natural fungicide
